title: Aleksandr Minayev (footballer, born 1958)
text:
Aleksandr Alekseyevich Minayev (; born 20 August 1958, died 12 March 2010) was a Russian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and coach.
Playing career.
He made his professional debut in the <a href="Soviet%20Second%20League">Soviet Second League</a> in 1976 for <a href="FC%20Volga%20Gorky">FC Volga Gorky</a>. He played 4 games in the <a href="UEFA%20Cup%201994%E2%80%9395">UEFA Cup 1994–95</a> for <a href="FC%20Tekstilshchik%20Kamyshin">FC Tekstilshchik Kamyshin</a>. Minayev played only for one club abroad, a season in Yugoslavia with Serbian side <a href="FK%20Budu%C4%87nost%20Valjevo">FK Budućnost Valjevo</a>.
Death.
He died in March 2010 in <a href="Voronezh">Voronezh</a>.
